intro: Impatiens arctosepala, commonly known as the Arctic sepala impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its alpine habitat. Its leaves are usually ovate and covered in a fine pubescence, which helps to reduce water loss. Impatiens arctosepala is a member of the Balsaminaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in botanical gardens.
